title: Buying & selling scams (fake sellers, fake listings, payment tricks)
summary: Scammers post fake listings or pretend to be genuine buyers/sellers to steal money or personal info.
how_it_works: A listing looks great (cheap price / high demand).
Scammer pushes off-platform payment or strange payment methods.
After payment, the item never arrives (or a buyer tricks you with fake payment confirmations).
warning_signs: Price is too good to be true.
You’re pressured to pay quickly or off-platform.
Excuses to avoid safe payment methods or in-person inspection.
example_hooks: “Pay now to secure it—lots of interest.”
what_to_do: Don’t send money to strangers via unusual methods.
Meet in safe public places for local pickups.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
